Description: Textile fragment from shoulder-area of undyed linen tunic of medium quality cloth; one plain selvedge folded back forming arm-hole and seam; part of rolled hem at neck; deterioration due to contact with resin suggests final use on mummy. Very worn - darning at the arm hole and neck. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.26 ends per 10mm and weft c.12 picks per 10mm. The seam and rolled hem are overcast in S-spin, weak Z-ply thread, darning in singles thread - darning consists of some lengthways laid threads but mainly of threads worked across in hitches grouping the warp threads (in one place above the shoulder chain stitch rather than hitches)
